TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EmptyControlCollection extends System.Web.UI.ControlCollection

Docs.summary: Provides standard support for a collection that is always empty.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is used when you want to define a custom control that does not allow child controls.
## Examples [!code-csharp[SystemWebUI_EmptyControlCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_EmptyControlCollection/CS/emptycontrolcollection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SystemWebUI_EmptyControlCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_EmptyControlCollection/VB/emptycontrolcollection.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.Control owner) cil managed

Docs.param: The that owns this collection as its collection of child controls.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example attempts to populate a control with child controls, causing an exception. This is because the container control does not allow child controls. The following is the command line used to build the executable. ```vb vbc /r:System.dll /r:System.Web.dll /t:library /out:myWebAppPath/bin/vb_myEmptyControlCollection.dll myEmptyControlCollection.vb ``` ```csharp csc /t:library /out:myWebAppPath/bin/cs_myEmptyControlCollection.dll myEmptyControlCollection.cs ``` [!code-csharp[SystemWebUI_EmptyControlCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_EmptyControlCollection/CS/emptycontrolcollection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SystemWebUI_EmptyControlCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_EmptyControlCollection/VB/emptycontrolcollection.vb#1)] The following code example uses the empty custom control defined above. When running this example, you will get an exception. Notice that the values shown in the `Register` directive reflect the previous command line. ```vb <%@ Register TagPrefix="custom" Assembly="vb_myEmptyControlCollection" Namespace="CustomControls" %>

Using an Empty Control

``` ```csharp <%@ Register TagPrefix="custom" Assembly="cs_myEmptyControlCollection" Namespace="CustomControls" %>

Using an Empty Control

```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Add(class System.Web.UI.Control child) cil managed

Docs.param: The to be added. This parameter is always ignored.
Docs.summary: Denies the addition of the specified object to the collection.
Docs.exception: Always issued, because the control does not allow child controls.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void AddAt (int index, System.Web.UI.Control child);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void AddAt(int32 index, class System.Web.UI.Control child) cil managed

Docs.param: The index at which to add the . This parameter is always ignored.
The to be added. This parameter is always ignored.
Docs.summary: Denies the addition of the specified object to the collection, at the specified index position.
Docs.exception: Always issued, because the control does not allow child controls.
